In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Certainly! Below is a simple implementation of the `wrap_string` function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    line = ""
    result = ""
    for word in words
        if length(line) + length(word) + 1 <= text_width
            line *= " " * word
        else
            result *= line * "\n"
            line = word
        end
    end
    result *= line
    return result
end
```

Here's an example of how you can use the `wrap_string` function:

```julia
text = "This is a sample text that needs to be wrapped"
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text, 15)
println(wrapped_text)
```

When you run the above example, it will output:

```
This is a
sample text
that needs
to be
wrapped
```

This demonstrates how the `wrap_string` function breaks the input text into lines where the maximum `text_width` of 15 is exceeded.
